SHOULD YOU TAKE CREATINE?â€¼ï¸/ DEBERÃAS TOMAR CREATINA? â€¼ï¸ Creatine is an organic acid that is produced as a consequence of the synthesis of 3 amino acids: arginine, glycine and methionine. It is the first source of energy of our body to face a physical effort. This first source is the ATP (adenosine triphosphate). Once creatine is released, it transfers its phosphate to the ADP (adenosine diphosphate) to start producing ATP, delaying muscle fatigue. How do we get creatine? By food and by its own internal production. So, should you take a creatine supplement? HELL YES! The reason why it's because you have to eat an excessive amount of food to get the quantity you need. Benefits: increases muscle strength and size, helps with recovery, improves brain function, helps muscle cells produce more energy, etc. My recommendation is to take 5gr of creatine monohydrate (the purest form of creatine) a day, it doesn't really matter when, just take it!! #motivation Where do you see yourself in 5, 10, 20 years? Everything you do now is going to affect your future one way or another, all the work you put in now is going to pay off in the years to come, and all your laziness in the present is going to bounce off in those years. Set long term goals, make a plan, have a vision of what's next. Everything you do in life should have a reason, a why, an ultimate goal. Yes, there are unpredictable events that you can't control and will affect your future; we all agree that living the present moment is great, but believe it or not time will pass, and your future is built mainly by what you do today. KNOW HOW TO CONTROL YOUR DIETâ€¼ï¸ As diet is the most complicated part to domain for the majority of people, here you have some tips ğŸ˜‰ 1ï¸âƒ£Know your calorie intake for maintenance: there is plenty of calculators on internet that make the numbers for you with different formulas, you can do it within 3 minutes. 2ï¸âƒ£Select a goal: subtract or add 300/500 kcal to that number depending on your goal (fat loss/muscle growth). 3ï¸âƒ£ Calculate your macros: 20/25 % of your DCI (daily calorie intake) should come from fats, so calculate the (for example) 20% of your DCI and divide it by 9 (1 gr fat =9kcal) ğŸ¥‘ â– For protein, multiply your body weight (in lb) for 1,1 - 1,3. â€¼ï¸PLEASE READ // POR FAVOR LEED â€¼ï¸ #transformationtuesday â¡ï¸2015-2017 Since I started my fitness journey I've never had anyone to teach me what to do, what to eat, how to train or what supplements to use. It has always been trial and error, learning things and applying them, making adjustments, learning during the process and pushing under any circumstances. No, I don't have an spectacular body, but fitness is not only about a physique, building muscle or losing fat, fitness is a way to face life, it's a lifestyle. I don't diet because I have to, I diet because I want to; I don't train 5-6 days a week because I have to, I do it because I want to do it. If I don't go out on a Friday night and instead I stay at home and wake up at 6am on a Saturday to go to the gym it's because I want to do it. Good morning #fitfam ğŸ˜ƒ here is my physique update: 67Kg, 10th week of my cut. As you can see, the change isn't anything insane, I mean, I haven't lost 12 kg in 3 months or anything like that. I've been losing weight slowly, controlling perfectly my diet and my training and trying to maintain as many muscle mass as possible. I started very early this year so I've been able to be on a not so dramatic deficit, avoiding hunger, enjoying cheat meals and continually losing fat. I've no finish line, meaning that I'm not prepping for a show, or a photo shoot or anything, I'll just keep losing fat until I think I'm lean enough. In fitness you need to fall in love with the process, otherwise you probably will eventually quit. Following a 12/16 weeks plan is easy, but being dedicated 24/7, 365 days/year, for years (in my case, for the rest of my life, because I f*cking love it) is not that simple. Stay motivated, trust the process and never quit ğŸ˜‰ - Buenos dÃ­as #fitfam ğŸ˜ƒ aquÃ­

EAT ENOUGH PROTEIN// CONSUME SUFICIENTE PROTEÃNA â€¼ï¸â€¼ï¸ While dieting, whether you are trying to gain muscle mass or lose fat, protein is crucial for successful results. Protein is the only macro that provides nitrogen to your organism. Nitrogen is a compound unique to protein that can provide a direct measure of ones amino acid (protein) status. Your body will only be in an anabolic state if your nitrogen balance is positive (which means you consume more protein than you excrete). Having a positive/negative nitrogen balance is what will determine if your are in an anabolic or catabolic state. How to keep it positive? Eat sufficient complete proteins, have enough rest and train in an anabolic fashion.
